intro: Halimolobos lasiolobus proles chihuahuaicus, commonly known as the Chihuahua hawksbeard, is a rare flowering plant native to the Chihuahua region of Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
